lines.text: That'll do, pig. That'll do.
Well, hey, slow down. If you're not a cat, stay and chat.

[during jelly bean distribution to the hungry animals]
Thank the pig.
I'm a sniffer, ya see. A fully qualified, triple-certificated sniffer.
Oh.
It's all in the hooter, the schnoz, the olfactory instrument. You could be a sniffer with a schnoz like that.
Open up, please. Open this door.
You got a problem, sweetie?
Um... uh...
Who is it, honey?
It's, uh... kind of a baldy, pinky, whitey thingy.
All I know is what I see. Tug comes in with the bag, just doin' his job, collectin' stuff, and you barge in here accusacating and making demandments.
And what have we here?
Well, um, we're in a negotiation with this naked, pink individual.
He's of foreign extraction, your honor.
Possibly even an alien.
This lowly, handless, deeply unattractive mudlover is a pig.
I'm not a porkpie.
Whatever you say, cutie pie.
I'm not any kind of pie. I'm just a pig on a mission.
Hey, dogs, you got any edibles? Any nibbley-dibbleys?
Eh, we got a carpet here with some nice spaghetti stains.
But we can't keep licking the carpet, can we, Alan?
We're going outside? Without a human? Could be kind of dangerous, you know, in a lethally sort of way.

Savage Dogs" sign]
Hello? Anybody home?
[dogs growling from the shadows]
Anybody else?

[Hiding in the shadows]
You must have a really thin grasp on Reality...
[Comes out into the light]
... unless of course; you're suicidal...

[nervously]
I was only looking for some Sheep.
I warned You!
[a Bull Terrier comes out of he shadows in attempts to attack Babe, as so does the Doberman]
You're very kind, but...
No, no, I'm anything but kind. In fact, I have a professional obligation to be malicious.
Then you should change jobs.

It is decreed that all cats and dogs put aside their instinctive and fanatical abhorrence of each other and that hereafter, all creatures great and diminutive shall be of equal stature, with rights to liberty and justice
[singing]
that nobody can deny. And so say all of us.
Ferdinand the duck, witness to insanity.
Sorry, Boss...
Please. Please. I know you're different from the others. Those that have had their way with me make their empty promises, but they are all lies - lies. And I'm afraid and terribly, terribly tired.
Where's your human?
My humans belong to someone else now. Someone younger and prettier.
Face it, you're just a little pig in the big city. What can you possibly do? What can anyone do? Why even try?
Well, I have to warn you, I may be small, but I can be ferocious if provoked.
It's all illusory - it's ill, and it's for losers.
Why?
